intro: Galium verum var. verosimile, commonly known as sweet woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves contain coumarin, which gives it a distinctive sweet scent and has been used in herbal remedies. It is also a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrance.
